value.title: Power Apps SVG make your apps prettier and easier to use
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn to use Power Apps SVGs to make prettier and easier to use apps. These small HTML controls let you do everything from make scalable images to full fledge animated visuals. Imagine Power BI style visuals in Power Apps without all of the extra licensing. Cool stuff!  w3Schools

value.title: PowerApps Send email - Everything you need to know about sending mail via Outlook and Power Apps
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn about Power Apps Send Email capabilities. We explore Microsoft365Outlook connector and how to set the To, Cc, Bcc, From, Attachments, Importance, html body, and more. So much fun with email.  Concat function for combining email address and making tables https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AnERfGIE8gw

value.title: PowerApps Reorder Gallery Items
value.excerpt: #PowerApps #Galleries In this video I walk you through how you can create an inline reordering mechanism for a Power Apps gallery.  I'll show how to dynamically reorder gallery items with up and down arrows to move them around.    You'll learn: ✅  How to add items to a collection ✅  How to delete items

value.title: Microsoft Power Apps Tutorial for Beginners -  Build an App in 5 Minutes
value.excerpt: Learn how to use PowerApps to build a quick application to write data to an Excel Spreadsheet. In this quick tutorial, you'll be off to the races with Power Apps by building an app from data.  For more Power Apps and Power Platform training, please visit us: https://pragmaticworkstraining.com  - - -

value.title: Microsoft PowerApps for Beginners - Build your first App (Tutorial)
value.excerpt: In this video we show beginners how to create their first Microsoft PowerApp from an Excel spreadsheet in OneDrive  We also show some small tweaks on how to streamline the automatically generated PowerApp. Learn how to: a) Prepare the Excel datasource in OneDrive b) Create the app c) Modify the gallery

value.title: Get started with AI Builder
value.excerpt: This self-paced module helps you build an AI model from the beginning and shows how you can use it in your business without writing a single line of code.

value.title: Introduction to Power Platform
value.excerpt: Introduction to Power Platform

value.title: PowerApps with a SharePoint List - Learn PowerApps Tutorial
value.excerpt: This is the first PowerApps Tutorial video in what will hopefully become a regular series of how to do things in PowerApps. Here we will walk through creating your first PowerApps App using SharePoint data, we will also make a few quick customizations to get you pointed in the right direction. This will

value.title: Get started with Power Apps

value.title: PowerApps Cascading Dropdown
value.excerpt: In today's show, you learn about PowerApps cascading dropdown menus. Nothing fancy but they are a must to make good apps for your users.  Other functions covered: If Reset Sort Distinct Disabled  For information or PowerApps consulting check out https://www.BoldZebras.com

value.title: PowerApps Forms - Introduction to data sources, data cards, and layout
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn about PowerApps Forms. This is the first of a multi-part series meant to help you learn all about this critical piece of PowerApps.   Topics covered in this video include: * Adding a data source * design controls for a form * data cards * connecting to a gallery  If you

value.title: Create a canvas app in Power Apps
value.excerpt: Do you want to create apps to help make your business more efficient? Then, this path is for you. It introduces you to Power Apps, helps you create and customize an app, and then manage and distribute it.

value.title: Manage apps in Power Apps
value.excerpt: Manage app versions, app sharing, and environments in Power Apps.

value.title: Custom SharePoint List Form with PowerApps
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn how to build a custom SharePoint List Form with PowerApps. You will start with the basics and learn how to get started and some of the potholes that are along the way. The SharePointIntegration connector is covered, modifying the form, adding an button, and how to delete

value.title: PowerApps filter gallery by dropdown
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn how to filter your gallery using one dropdown, two dropdowns, and a search box. Lots of fun to be learned here. We also cover the distinct function and the collect function along the way.   Power Apps training at https://training.PowerApps911.com

value.title: Working with a PowerApps Collection
value.excerpt: In this video, we learn about PowerApps collection. These are a special type of variable that allows you to collect a table worth of information as a variable. You can use it for things like creating a shopping cart.   Functions used:  * Collect * ClearCollect * Patch * Remove * ThisItem * Gallery  Video
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yS6mTRlmuls" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Learn to use the PowerApps Filter function
value.excerpt: In this show, we explore the PowerApps Filter Function. We discuss the function, how to build a search box, the nuances of the PowerApps Filter SharePoint, and build a custom PowerApps Filter Gallery. Very cool stuff.   Document on PowerApps Delegation https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/delegation-overview

value.title: Customize a canvas app in Power Apps
value.excerpt: Learn how to customize an app by adding controls, images, and logic.

value.title: Learn to connect: PowerApps Excel Spreadsheet hosted in OneDrive
value.excerpt: Do you want to learn to use PowerApps Excel Spreadsheets? Then this video is for you. We take an Excel workbook hosted in OneDrive for Business and use it as a data source for PowerApps. This video is the foundation that will let us explore more complicated scenarios in the future.  PowerApps for SharePoint

value.title: PowerApps Forms - Form Mode

value.title: PowerApps Save Data - Patch, Collect, and ForAll

We explore adding some controls to the screen and then using Patch, Collect, and ForAll to save the data back to our data source. We even have a special Halloween theme. For a Bonus we also talk about the Media Control.  AddColumns, ShowColumns,

value.title: Building Your First PowerApp to Update Excel
value.excerpt: Ep29. Learn how to build a simple PowerApp that uses Excel as a source for updating, inserting and deleting data. value.title: Beginner Power Apps Topics by April Dunnam
value.excerpt: If you are new to Power Apps then this playlist is for you!  It's full of beginner level Power Apps topics to get you started building low code apps

topItems.title: How to get started with Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: #PowerApps #Beginner  The most common question that I'm asked is "I'm new to Power Apps, how do I get started?"  Learning any new technology can be overwhelming.  In this video I list the steps you need to take to start learning Power Apps.  If you are brand new to Power Apps then this is the video to
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-H4ljf4FuTE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Power Apps Canvas vs Model Driven vs Portals Explained
topItems.excerpt: #PowerApps #PowerAppsTypes #Beginner Are you new to Power Apps?  Then this video is for you!  After you watch my video on "How to Get Started with Power Apps", this video is a good next step in that learning path.   I'll explain what Power Apps is and go over the three different types of Power Apps that

topItems.title: Power Apps Sorting - Multi Column Sort, Sort Button, Sort and Filter
topItems.excerpt: #PowerApps #Sorting This Beginner Fundamentals Quick Tip is all about Power Apps Sorting.  You'll learn the basics of sorting including how to plan for sorting with delegation in mind, how to sort by multiple columns, how to add sorting in combination with filtering and more!  Table of Contents: 00:00

topItems.title: PowerApps: Using the Same Form Control for New and Edit
topItems.excerpt: #PowerApps #PowerAppsForms In this video I show you a quick tip on how to use a function to switch your PowerApps Form Mode between New and Edit.  This enables you to cut down on the number of screens and form controls by using the same screen to handle new item and existing item inputs.   For more PowerApps,

value.title: PowerApps Combobox - Search, Filter, Default values, and more
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn about the PowerApps Combobox. There are examples for configuring, searching, filtering, selected vs. selecteditems, default vs defaultitems, datasources, items, and more. Lots of things to learn on this control  For more help check out PowerApps911 https://www.powerapps911.com

value.title: PowerApps PDF Generator using Microsoft Flow PDF Converter
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn how to create a PDF using the power of PowerApps, Flow, and OneDrive. We walk through everything from generating the HTML, to filling in the variables, adding Flow actions, and finally sending content from PowerApps to the PDF. Very cool.  John Liu's original blog post on

value.title: PowerApps Search Function
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn about the PowerApps Search Function. We will cover how to build your own search box, why you get that blue CIRCLE (Delegation), SharePoint Look-Up Columns, and other things you need to know to keep building awesome apps.  PowerApps Delegation Overview https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/delegation-overview

value.title: Intro to PowerApps Variables
value.excerpt: In this video, you will get an intro to PowerApps Variables. We first start with an overview of why you might not need variables because of the Excel-like functionality. Then we dive into contextual and global variables. Fun stuff!   PowerApps Playlist https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLCGGtLsUjhm2bonhBZuEhZU72QkFjOp

value.title: PowerApps Repeating Tables like InfoPath Part 1 - Enter the data
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn how to create PowerApps repeating tables like you had in InfoPath. We will use SharePoint lists as the data sources and create an expense report. We will do this by customizing a gallery to make it the repeating table including full tab support for easy data entry.   Part
